noun.description: A sustained and enthusiastic show of appreciation from an audience, especially by means of applause.
examples: the performance received a thundering ovation

noun.description: A processional entrance into Rome by a victorious commander, of lesser honor than a triumph.

origin: Early 16th century (in ovation (sense 2)): from Latin ovatio(n-), from ovare exult. The word had the sense exultation from the mid 17th to early 19th century.
